UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_TITLE: Provide guidance on the strategic governance of NQF implementation by education, training and development providers
UNITSTANDARD.ETQA_NAME: Education, Training and Development Practices Sector Education and Training Authority
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_PURPOSE:
This unit standard is for those responsible for the general oversight and accountability of the organisation, and who have a special interest in the implementation of the NQF within the organisation.
People credited with this unit standard are able to: > Explain key concepts of strategic governance as it relates to learning organisations; > Identify accountability and responsibility levels of governance structures for a learning organisation; and > Guide the strategic governance planning process.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_LEARNING_ASSUMPTIONS: It is assumed that people starting to learn towards this unit standard are already competent in terms of the unit standard: > Demonstrate understanding of the outcomes-based education and training approach within the context of a National Qualifications Framework
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_RANGE: Range statements are included in the body of the unit standard as needed.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_ACCREDITATION_OPTIONS:
> Assessors for this unit standard must be registered with the relevant ETQA.
> Providers offering learning towards this unit standard must be accredited by the relevant ETQA.
> Moderation of assessment will be overseen by the relevant ETQA according to moderation guidelines and agreed ETQA procedures.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_CCFO_IDENTIFYING: Identify and solve problems: using critical and creative thinking to propose strategic governance structures.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_CCFO_WORKING: Work effectively with others and in teams: determining needs.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_CCFO_ORGANIZING: Organise and manage oneself and one`s activities responsibly and effectively: the level of planning involves high levels of organisation and management.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_CCFO_COLLECTING: Collect, analyse, organise and critically evaluate information: analyzing the environment for implementation.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_CCFO_COMMUNICATING: Communicate effectively using visual, mathematical and/or language skills: communicating the plans.
UNITSTANDARD.UNIT_STD_NOTES:
Supplementary Information:
Terms have been clarified as far as possible through the use of range statements.
Acronymns and abbreviations used:
> ETQA: Education and Training Quality Assurance Body > NQF: National Qualifications Framework

SPECIFICOUTCOME.OUTCOME_TITLE: Explain key concepts of strategic governance as it relates to providers.

ASSESSMENTCRITERIA.ASSESSMENT_CRITERION_DESC: Definitions of strategic governance are consistent with established literature and best practice.
Key principles underpinning good governance are explained and related to their application within a learning provider environment.
Explanations of the notion of cooperative governance and its relationship to decentralised administration reveal insight into its opportunities and challenges.
The roles of strategic governance are clarified in distinction to the roles of management.

SPECIFICOUTCOME.OUTCOME_TITLE: Identify accountability and responsibility levels of governance structures for a provider.

ASSESSMENTCRITERIA.ASSESSMENT_CRITERION_DESC: Roles and responsibilities within the governance structures of the provider are identified as per organisational definitions.
Descriptions are provided to show how the governance structures work to promote and implement the NQF.
Models of strategic governance are applied to illustrate the interactions of various roleplayers.

SPECIFICOUTCOME.OUTCOME_TITLE: Guide the strategic governance planning process.

ASSESSMENTCRITERIA.ASSESSMENT_CRITERION_DESC: The process includes an analysis of the status of the provider with regard to strategic governance. The analysis reveals strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and strengths in strategic governance.
The planning process establishes priorities for successful initiation of strategic governance.
Guidance results in a comprehensive plan for strategic governance that includes the provider`s vision, mission, values and strategy, and takes account of responsibilities with regard to the NQF.
Plans identify resources, actions, timeframes, roles, responsibilities and structures required to promote the concept of strategic governance.

Guidance contributes towards ensuring the general accountability and quality management of the provider in order to maintain its accreditation status and its credibility as a generator of qualified graduates.
Guidance helps the provider to maximize opportunities and takes up the challenges and responsibilities implicit in involvement with the NQF.
